entry.title: You Writing this Down, Miss Gazette?
entry.summary:
Author: finkhiscool

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 55,140Chapters: 16/16Kudos: 630

Summary: Y/N, a crime reporter at the Gotham Gazette, catches a lead about the Red Hood, new crime lord terrorizing… other crime lords? And what is the guy's connection to The Bat? Well, you guess it's better than terrorizing the public like every other rogue.You’ll uncover his story no matter what it takes.Jason has been through Hell and back. Now, he’s back in his beloved, blood-covered Gotham City. Black Mask and Batman won’t know what hit them. And the, uh, the reporter—he doesn’t quite know what to do about her.He’ll change Gotham from the inside out like Bruce never could.(Smut starts chap 5, if you’re curious)

entry.title: Since You've Been Gone
entry.summary:
Author: suberbantokyodrift

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,784Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 60

Summary: Ten years ago you were in high school with Jason Todd and assigned as science partners. But a week after, he dies. His death shook you to the point you have to live with your divorced father in the Midwest. Ten years later, however, you move back to help take care of your ailing grandmother. Jason, however, is very much alive. Well, resurrected. And he doesn't plan on you leaving his life again.

entry.title: Strangers in the Night
entry.summary:
Author: unnamedmystery

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,455Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 76

Summary: When the Daily Planet heard word of a new vigilante in Crime Alley that supposedly had no affiliation with Batman, Perry White thought it to be a nice short story—a quick in and out. After all, while the people of Metropolis had Superman, everyone knew of Batman, and a vigilante not working with him seemed interesting.At least, that’s what Perry told his college intern. And her mentor Clark Kent when he raised concerns.No one told her that the vigilante was intimidatingly attractive. Or that Crime Alley was the worse place in Gotham City. Or that her mentor would ask a friend to keep tabs on her. Or that the detective she’s staying with hates Batman despite working with him frequently. Or that the detectives neighbor was a really cute guy.

entry.title: Burning House
entry.summary:
Author: Yes_I_have_daddy_issues

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,181Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 15

Summary: We were kids together, growing up in the same crime ridden alleyways and neighborhoods, just two doors down the road from each other. “I’ll find a way.” he turned back to face me, a big smile stretching across his face, one I would never forget, the light in his eyes visible.I never saw Jason again after that night. Not in person at least.On the news, getting adopted by Bruce Wayne of all people, waving and smiling to the cameras, it never reached his eyes the way his smile always did when we were younger.Then he vanished for good.

entry.title: Project Shattercore
entry.summary:
Author: rikaisdeadx

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,023Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 79

Summary: you were taken so young—too young to remember anything but needles and pain. locked in a lab that never quieted, they amplified every whisper of thought within you, reshaping you into something beyond what you should have been. after endless experiments, your rescuer finally arrives.he’s tall, shadowed by secrets, and undeniably frightening… yet somehow, he offers you a place to belong. in the vast, silent halls of his mansion, you feel invisible—an outsider blamed for every strange glance. but as days pass and walls of stone seem to soften, the people here begin to notice you. they smile. they reach out. and you start to wonder: is this longing in their eyes… normal?

entry.title: Red Hood, Green Heart
entry.summary:
Author: Persadol

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,273Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 26

Summary: Jason Todd has died before-and he hasn't quite come back whole. Haunted by shadows of his past and the weight of justice in Gotham, he finds comfort only in silence and the static crackle of Alfred's voice in his comms.That is, until the night a portal rips open above him and a very unexpected visitor-blue-skinned, horned, and definitely not from this world-crashes straight into his life. Literally.You're a druid from the forests of the Forgotten Realms, on a peaceful path of healing and harmony… until a bandit ambush and a wild spell gone wrong land you flat on top of a masked stranger in a dark, alien city.Jason doesn't do magic. You don't do guns. But somehow, between Gotham rooftops and druidic spells, trauma and trust, gunfire and green growth-you might just change each other's worlds.
